results.title: Power for Uganda
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley
results.brief_description: Records the planning, construction, and opening of the Owen Falls hydro-electric station near the source of the Nile River. A model is used to explain the purpose of the various dams. Stresses the importance of the dam to Uganda, for as well as harnessing power for industry it will provide an adequate year-round supply of water.

results.title: Power for the highlands
results.creator_credit: A Paul Rotha Production and Jack Chambers
results.brief_description: The mountains and glens of Scotland’s highlands look beautiful to the visitor. Yet there are few people living there. Bracken has wasted the hill-sides, where the land which should be supporting sheep and cattle lies unchecked towards sea-level, taking the topsoil with it, and turning the valleys into bogs. The North of Scotland Hydro-Electricity Board was set up to convert this ruinous water into power, and to promote and develop the highlands. This film was shot in Gen Aric, Strathfarrar, Duckie and Galloway.

results.title: Power changes Mexico
results.creator_credit: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
results.brief_description: Shows the importance of electric power for Mexico’s people, explaining how industrialization offers new careers, eases the burden for women in the villages and generally promises a higher standard of living. Shows contrast of riches and poverty in Mexico, illustrating how hydro-electric schemes raise the general welfare of the community as a whole.

results.title: Power and the political man
results.creator_credit: Country Education Project and David Zweck
results.brief_description: A panel consisting of Peter Couchman, Tony Staley, David McKenzie, Bruce Grant and Graham Little consider the theme: Power and the political man. Issues dicussed include the ways in which power is achieved; why some seek power, how power is exercised and the effect it has on those who achieve it and then lose it; and the sources of power. The discussion covers these issues as they relate to the texts; “The Prince” by Machiavelli, “Mahatma Gandhi and his Apostles” by Ved Mehta, “All the Kings Men” by Robert Penn Warren and “Quiet Americans” by Graham Greene.

results.title: Power and glory
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Ron Johnston and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
Virtually the sole source of learning in the western Dark Ages, the Bible’s character’s and stories were used to justify the social order and to offer its citizens security in this world and the next. After the fall of the Roman Empire, Christianity was nurtured in small settlements places like Ireland and Scotland. From these monastries came the most beautiful illuminated manuscripts of Bible text. Charlemagne restored Christianity to its glory and feudal society mirrored that of the Bible with its emphasis on order and place. Also features a close look at the ancient Byzantine church of Haiga Sophia in Istanbul.

results.title: Power and corruption
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Themes of Literature”.
This specially edited version of Polanski’s “Macbeth” focuses on the dramatic chain of events precipitated by Macbeth’s killing of Duncan, his king. One of the results of the sinister murder is that Macbeth is crowned King of Scotland in an impressive ceremony at Scone. The other fruits of his action, however, are bitter, for Macbeth has to learn that power illegally gained corrupts no one so much as him who gets it.

results.title: Power among men
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Office of Public Information, Julien Bryan and Thorold Dickinson
results.brief_description: This is the first feature-length film to deal with the idea and purposes of the UN. It is a film about two forces which co-exist in humankind; power to build and power to destroy. Man prides himself on being the builder of civilisations. He cannot deny that he is an equally effective destroyer. The film leaves the viewer with the knowledge that it is up to man himself to make the choice. In sequences filmed in Italy, Haiti, Norway and Canada the film shows how man’s abilities have been put to use and how his powers have been applied. The positive need for human beings to find lasting solutions to the problems of controlling their destructive power is dramatically illustrated.

results.title: Power
results.brief_description: Power system in automobiles. Cylinder; piston operation; 4-cycle action of intake, compression, power and exhaust; differences between 1, 4 and 6 cylinder engines; power turning the wheels. Animated diagrams assist the explanations.
